Jsu3wn88XCuAvzgYBg4pGQ.text: Great for kids. Service is very good. We live nearby and this has become one of our regular places to grab a casual dinner at.

ZaAS4IZ5KC1oP6xgu2Sphw.text: A lovely spot in the middle of the garden. Great air conditioning and nice ambience. Lovely patient wait staff is a nice bonus. Food wise, the dishes were average. I don't feel wow'd but they are decent. Skip the beef cheek Benedict though. While tender and soft, it was devoid of any beefy flavors.The waffle is worth a mention. Love the crispy outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Canopy Garden Dining & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Lobster linguine
Photo of Canopy Garden Dining & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Beef cheek Benedict
Photo of Canopy Garden Dining & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Salmon Benedict

5QwwZuC653eU0Ek8p6B_kg.text: The setting and ambience look nice but don't be fooled. Beneath the shiny veneer is some really lackluster food that's not worth the asking price. Had brunch with family here and service was spotty and the food wasn't timed well at all.  Dishes were coming out sporadically with long waits between them. Someone had asked if they could omit bacon from the avocado wrap but we were told they couldn't because they are pre-rolled. I mean that's pretty lazy shit if you can't make an avocado wrap to order. Ironically I ordered the avocado roll and was among the last to be served even though it was already pre-made and all they did was microwave it. You can taste the lack of effort in the wrap which was a trend repeated among all the other dishes from salmon in broth to the angus cheeseburger - sloppy, lacking flavor, and miserly portions. The only saving grace is that the space is quite comfortable but hardly worth the price. You can get way better elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Canopy Garden Dining & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Lackluster avocado wrap

DTDycC009ke11xIjqbIHCA.text: The food is good and the setting in a garden is pretty! The service was bad as it was obvious the restaurant is understaffed for a Sunday lunch/brunch. Ignored 3a few times by the waitresses to take orders. It took the next table to help let the waitress know of our existence. Thought we were smiling and friendly? Or is it our color?

68c3ikrAmF2yTbt6Nq5obg.text: The only bright spot about this place is that it has an outdoor seating area for dog owners and their pets. And that is about as good as it gets. Many have commented about the food, which is just decent, nothing spectacular. I'm not so generous. It was food that I could have prepared at home, and probably would have made it better. And for the price they charge, you do feel cheated. Especially since it's park land, and rental suppose to be lower. And then there's the service, which many point out as a positive. I do agree, the staff are friendly, but they could be a lot more efficient and attentive to details. For example, we were a table of 6, but they only provided 5 sets of cutlery in the little pail, coffee came without the sugar etc. And so there was always the additional need to summon their attention when it could have been avoided. And don't get me started about how long it took to settle the bill, longer than it took to eat my salad!So go, but only if you have a dog. There's little reason otherwise.

photos.caption: Photo of Canopy Garden Dining & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Kids ham and cheese sandwich. $8?!
Photo of Canopy Garden Dining & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Wow

CIRZHBp4ckQvXiXZ3nzHFw.text: Peaceful environment to catch up with friends and family.Sometimes it's the environment that sets the tone for your meet up. The peaceful and considerably quiet environment created a nice, calming ambience which is great for catch up with friends without the need to shout across tables. We had 1 toddler and 1 baby in toll, felt the environment made the kids more relaxed.I have been to this park many times but this is my first time dining at this cafe. We were there at 9am, and were the only customers for quite awhile before 4 more patrons arrived.Almost all of us ordered the grilled breakfast. A decent size/portion for the price. It was enjoyable and filling. Their coffee was not great though. Latte felt bland.The parking lot is directly in front of the cafe which is great. There are also bus stop which are very close by too.Overall, a peaceful cafe to hang out with friends and families.

j2C0ViRoeBDRK5ah_B89jA.text: Such a lovely setting for a restaurant but I was disappointed by the food. It wasn't bad but it could have been so much better. My daughter had chicken nuggets and French fries. The nuggets looked and tasted like cheap, frozen ones - they're so easy to make from scratch! I'm pretty certain the fries were frozen out of a bag too. I had the cheese burger which while tasty, loved the bacon jam, came on a pre-made bun. Again, so easy to make from scratch. Husband had the avocado wrap which looked and tasted great.Service was pretty good and as I mentioned it is a lovely setting inside the park. I'm thinking that if you just did the brunch options the food might be better but I was quite underwhelmed by the experience.

xjk7vOMUZihWfYx5uhrPbQ.text: Nested within Bishan Partk- this restaurant is quite a quaint and green departure from the usual restaurant concealed within a shopping mall ... or perched, semi-alfresco, off the ground floor of a restored shophouse! Ordered its eggs benedict, which was described on the menu to come with "perfectly poached eggs" - at below $15! Eggs were indeed "perfectly poached" Sufficiently savory, but somehow lacklustre as a whole! I guess the poached eggs could really do with more hollandaise sauce!Had its sticky date dessert dish which was the only tempting item in the sweets section of the menu! Would give it a 6 out of 10!Lovely service! Good prices! But the place is just a tad too inaccessible for diners who don't drive. For diners who drive - loads of parking lots just outside of the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon!

pQLWOvhZ1xdQIA_599w0Vg.text: The canopy garden dining and bar is set within the refurbished bishan park which makes it a nice setting for a weekend brunch or drinks after dinner.Their eggs benedict and eggs florentine are both quite good. I have also tried their okonomiyaki pancake and it just tasted a bit strange. I just didn't get it.I have been here for drinks and would not really reccommend it for the quality for their drinks. But the ambience is actually quite good for a quiet chat. So, just focus on the surroundings and your company, more than the drinks available.Another thing about canopy is that dogs are allowed in here, which is very cool. So there are quite a few pet owners with their dogs here especially during weekends. Hence, if you are allergic to furry cute dogs, it may be a good idea to steer clear during the weekends.I think the food, drinks and service really warrants about 3 stars but I just really like the idea of dining within a lovely park so this gets 3.5 stars! Do try this place if you are in the area.

djvPMx4Au0sA2TdhnB7vKA.text: a really nice spot in the park so much potential but the food was so so. service was extremely slow. cant say id recommend it unless these things changed

x_htG4_ieiG2mfTCcPt-WA.text: Not really sure how to categorize this place since it is a restaurant and cafe in the day that serves brunch and mains, but in the evenings they kinda turn into sort of a 1 Twenty Six type of garden bar/pub. I do know that this is quite a hidden find and a cool spot to visit. Situated in the very pleasant Bishan Park, you can drive in and park quite easily. Walk a little inside and you're surrounded by greenery. It is very cooling even in the day and doggie-friendly. At night it transforms into a great place for some drinks (slightly overpriced) with a easy and open-air atmosphere.For a place like Bishan/AMK, this place just adds a bit more of the chic-ness to the area that is not too heartland. Great for dates!

j2tn8zOd5vBM81ps2JxO4w.text: Quite a unique place this.  With a cafe style restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating, hidden in the greenery further into the 'garden' you will find The Middle Rock bar or a further cafe restaurant called The Green Room which is an Eco-dining affair.Actually all three form what is described as an Australian style dining cafe food experience.  Having not been to Australia I can't confirm or deny this claim but what I do know is that the food is good, the service relaxed and the beer cold!We visited early evening with a couple of three year olds and sat in the garden with its very welcome large cooling fans whirring away.  Our girls had pizza and fish and chips from the kids menu whilst the adults had a salad, pasta carbonara, Sakura chicken and a wagyu burger.  All the food was good although I am still getting used to the Singaporean way of delivering plates at varying times with little regard for people having to wait for their fellow diners!  Seemingly they bring it out when it's ready - pros and cons.Traveling with a gluten and lactose intolerant sweet toothed wife is a trial sometimes as dessert inevitably ends up being a choice of fruit or sorbet, however with The Green Room nearby Canopy was able to offer, from the menu, a rice based chocolate cake with vegan ice cream - we were very impressed and super pleased!The prices seem pretty standard for Singapore which is a little more than we would expect to pay at home with alcoholic drinks being quite expensive and don't forget that tax and service are on top of the menu price.However we had a lovely time in a pretty setting and would recommend anyone try it.  Don't forget the mosquito spray though when spending an evening in Bishan Park.
